lyrics.text:
How lovely, Lord, how lovely is Your abiding place; my soul is longing, fainting, to feast upon Your grace.
The sparrow finds a shelter, a place to build her nest; and so Your temple calls us within its walls to rest.

In Your bless'd courts to worship, O God, a single day is better than a thousand if I from You should stray.
I'd rather keep the entrance and claim You as my LORD than revel in the riches the ways of sin afford.
